channel.title: Which Office Suite do you use? Microsoft Office or Open Office?
channel.description:
Which Office Suite do you use? Microsoft Office or Open Office?
[b]Comments are very very much appreciated.[/b]
An [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Office_suite]Office Suite[/url] is the several popular programs that are best known by Microsoft as Excel, Word, Powerpoint, Access, and a few other ones.
[url=http://office.microsoft.com]Microsoft Office[/url] is probably what you have because you need it for printing your documents like essays and what not and managing accounts using excel and whatever else. Microsoft does give what it promises, though the big problem with Microsoft, is that there is always a plethora of ways for it to crash and nothing is free. According to [url=http://www.bestbuy.com/site/olspage.jsp?id=pcmcat112800050005&type=category]Best Buys[/url] the Office Standard 2007 - Windows is $400.00! [url=http://images.google.com/images?svnum=10&um=1&hl=en&q=microsoft+office+screenshots&btnG=Search+Images]Microsoft Office Screenshots[/url]
[url=http://www.openoffice.org]Open Office[/url] is everything what Microsoft promises and more. Best of all it's constantly updated, it can "save to"/"load from" Microsoft file types like popular .doc (Word) and .ppt (Powerpoint) files, it's open source so bugs are quickly found and fixed, and best of all, Open Office is FREE!
[img]http://openoffice.blogs.com/openoffice/images/top10.png[/img]
Open Office has different names for their programs in their suite so Microsoft will not be able to sue them. Screenshots of Open Office are included in the links. Microsoft Word - [url=http://www.openoffice.org/product/writer.html]Open Office Writer[/url] Microsoft Excel - [url=http://www.openoffice.org/product/calc.html]Open Office Calc[/url] Microsoft PowerPoint - [url=http://www.openoffice.org/product/impress.html]Open Office Impress[/url] N/A in Microsoft - [url=http://www.openoffice.org/product/draw.html]Open Office Draw[/url] Microsoft Access - [url=http://www.openoffice.org/product/base.html]Open Office Base[/url] N/A in Microsoft - [url=http://www.openoffice.org/product/math.html]Open Office Math[/url] Microsoft Quick Starter - Open Office Quick Starter - "It loads the core files and libraries for OpenOffice.org during computer startup and allows the suite applications to start more quickly when selected later." - Wikipedia
If you'd like to download Open Office, please do so and spread the word! It's the Firefox of Office Suites! You'll love it. http://www.openoffice.org
I'm just running this poll out of curiosity and in hopes that some people may switch to Open Office. At first, it was going to be unbiased, but then I said to myself, who are you kidding and then said screw it, and completed this. :)
For curiosity's sake, for some more information here is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OpenOffice.org]Wikipedia article of OpenOffice[/url] and a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_office_suites]List of Office Suites[/url].
~Ron

item.title: Which Office Suite do you use? Microsoft Office or Open Office?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

jme_009:

I use mircosoft office but only because open office is too slow for me. We use open office at school and it works great. But on my computer there is a huge delay when typing. You type, it appears 2 seconds later.

Mine works perfectly.

Read full topic

item.description:
@shadow235 wrote:

Open-Office, Microsoft Office is a useless if you can get the same product for free.

item.title: Which Office Suite do you use? Microsoft Office or Open Office?
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

[quote=“Bebemycat2, post:12, topic:96862”][quote author=DeadBird link=topic=139537.msg1344562#msg1344562 date=1179632670]
Office '03
'07 and OO are crap imo.
[/quote][/quote]

Gotta second that.

I use Open Office just because it’s free, and I can’t be bothered trying to steal Microsoft Office and shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Which Office Suite do you use? Microsoft Office or Open Office?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:9, topic:96862”][quote author=jme_009 link=topic=139537.msg1342005#msg1342005 date=1179607305]
I use mircosoft office but only because open office is too slow for me. We use open office at school and it works great. But on my computer there is a huge delay when typing. You type, it appears 2 seconds later.
[/quote]
Cool for your school, but sad for you man. You must have a little bit of a slow computer or at least over 30 processes running. If that’s true, then run this download. And if you run that, tell me if you notice a change. :)[/quote]

Well, it’s not that slow. It’s a decent computer. Not really up to todays standards, but it’s a better computer then what they have at school. amd athlon 2800+ 2.1 ghz, 1 gb ram… etc. But I mean the computer runs fine, and perfectly fast. It’s just open office that does that. It also does it with SIDE.

Also I don’t have many processes, and I have plenty of free ram available. Ah well… I don’t have the need to use word processors very often, usually I can get everything done at school.

Read full topic
item.source: Which Office Suite do you use? Microsoft Office or Open Office?

item.title: Which Office Suite do you use? Microsoft Office or Open Office?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

jme_009:

I use mircosoft office but only because open office is too slow for me. We use open office at school and it works great. But on my computer there is a huge delay when typing. You type, it appears 2 seconds later.

Cool for your school, but sad for you man. You must have a little bit of a slow computer or at least over 30 processes running. If that’s true, then run this download. And if you run that, tell me if you notice a change.

[quote=“yakman, post:6, topic:96862”]well i use Microsoft office, but i think I might try this Open Office, it sounds very good
its not really the price which bothers me since I get it all pirate :p, but i guess it would just be to help an OOS project :D[/quote]
Cool. Hope you like it!

[quote=“goatee, post:7, topic:96862”][quote author=Ron link=topic=139537.msg1341891#msg1341891 date=1179606254]

Office 2007 is very nice.

So is the price.
[/quote]
Who pays for software?[/quote]
I don’t really know what to say to that besides that instead of committing a crime by stealing software, you can use the straight way, and get a better more flexible product for free. Seems like a win win to me, but it’s your choice/opinion.

Read full topic

item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

At school, the main ICT teacher was proper hardcore OSS for life, he give a new teacher shit for installing some windows programs on his main computer.

Anyways, we got used to OpenOffice and NvU pretty quick.

item.description:
@MybJames wrote:

I use and like MS Word 07.

I think that it is simpler and i like the previews of font/pictures before you actually apply.
Although, i may have to be doing some getting used to.
